fs.validate
Class LabelIndicValidator<T>

java.lang.Object
  fs.validate.AbstractComponentValidator<T>
      fs.validate.LabelIndicValidator<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentValidator<T>, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
NonEmptyWarner, TabooValidator
public abstract class LabelIndicValidator<T>
extends AbstractComponentValidator<T>

This class implements a ComponentValidator, where each registered component may be linked to a SwitchIconLabel, which is modified according to the validation status of the component. The Validator is created with three icons, one for 'correct' state , one for 'warning' and one for 'incorrect' state. After each validation run, the icon of the label for each Component is set accordingly. A tooltip text can also be set.

Author:
Simon Hampe

Constructor Detail

LabelIndicValidator

public LabelIndicValidator(javax.swing.ImageIcon correct,
                           javax.swing.ImageIcon warning,
                           javax.swing.ImageIcon incorrect)
This creates a validator which will set the icons of associated labels according to the content status of the component. It is recommended, that all three icons are of the same size (if they aren't null), so that the label will not change its size.

Parameters:
correct - The icon for correct content (If null, no icon is displayed)
warning - The icon for content that produces a warning ( If null, no icon is displayed)
incorrect - The icon for incorrect content (If null, no icon is displayed)
Method Detail

validate

public ValidationResult validate()
Runs a validation on all registered components and will set the icons of the associated labels accordingly. If an icon for a certain state has been set to null, the icon is simply disabled (i.e. setIconVisible(false) is called).

Specified by:
validate in interface ComponentValidator<T>
Overrides:
validate in class AbstractComponentValidator<T>

addComponent

                         SwitchIconLabel associatedLabel)
Adds a component for validation and associates it to the specified label

setToolTipText

public void setToolTipText(T component,
                           java.lang.String text)
Sets the tooltip text of the label associated to the component. If no label is associated, this call has no effect
